skill.name: task-execution-engine
skill.description: Execute implementation tasks from design documents using markdown checkboxes. Use when (1) implementing features from feature-design-assistant output, (2) resuming interrupted work, (3) batch executing tasks. Triggers on 'start implementation', 'run tasks', 'resume'.
skill.summary: Execute implementation tasks from design documents using markdown checkboxes. Use when (1) implement...
skill.author: notedit

security_audit.summary: This is a simple markdown-based task management utility. It only reads and writes files explicitly specified via command-line arguments. No network access, no external command execution, no environment variable reads, and no code execution capabilities. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.user_title: Execute implementation tasks from design documents
content.value_statement: Managing feature implementation across scattered todo lists and design documents wastes time and causes missed tasks. Task execution engine reads structured task lists directly from markdown design files and executes them one by one with automatic checkbox updates.
actual_capabilities: Read task lists from markdown design documents
Execute tasks in priority order with dependency checking
Mark tasks as completed or failed with reasons
Show progress status and next task to execute
Resume interrupted work from any point
Support nested task criteria with checkboxes
limitations: Only works with markdown files in the specified task format
Does not execute the actual implementation code itself
Requires design document to be written first
No built-in code review or testing integration

use_cases.title: Implement features from designs
use_cases.description: Turn feature designs into working code using structured task checklists that track progress automatically

use_cases.title: Coordinate team implementations
use_cases.description: Create shared design documents with task breakdowns that multiple developers can execute independently

use_cases.title: Run automated implementation pipelines
use_cases.description: Enable AI agents to work through feature implementations step by step with verifiable completion criteria

prompt_templates.title: Batch execute
prompt_templates.prompt: Run all pending tasks from docs/designs/[feature-name].md until completion

output: - User model has email and password_hash fields

best_practices: Break down each task into specific, verifiable acceptance criteria before implementation
Review the full task list and dependencies before starting to understand the architecture
Use the fail command with clear reasons when blocked to help with recovery later
anti_patterns: Skipping the task list and jumping directly into coding without a plan
Using design files that do not follow the markdown checkbox format
Implementing tasks without checking the acceptance criteria for each one

faq.question: Which AI coding tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and any Claude Code compatible interface. No special configuration required.

faq.question: How many tasks can this manage at once?
faq.answer: The skill can handle any number of tasks. Performance depends on file size and reading speed of the markdown file.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: This skill reads output from feature-design-assistant. Provide the design file path and it will execute all listed tasks automatically.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads and writes files you explicitly specify. No data is sent to external servers or third parties.

faq.question: What if implementation gets interrupted?
faq.answer: Simply run the command again with the same design file. The skill automatically finds the first incomplete task and continues from there.

faq.question: How is this different from regular todo apps?
faq.answer: This skill integrates directly with design documents. Tasks stay with the design specifications, enabling Git-friendly diffs and single source of truth.
